# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:, "ym"] = map(x -> string(Dates.year(x)) * string(Dates.month(x)[2:end]), df.dt)
    return df
end
```

This function uses the `map` function to iterate over each element in the `dt` column of the DataFrame `df`. For each date time, it extracts the year using `Dates.year(x)` and the month using `Dates.month(x)[2:end]` (to remove the leading zero). Then, it concatenates these two strings together to form a six-digit string in the format "yyyymm". Finally, it assigns this new column named "ym" to the DataFrame.

To use this function, simply call it with your DataFrame:

```julia
df = ... # Your existing DataFrame with 'dt' column of DateTimes
new_df = add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will return a new DataFrame `new_df` with an additional column "ym" containing the year and month concatenated as integers in the format "yyyymm".
